AK.notes:
Total tests are taken from the annotations on the charts on the page. 
Negatives = (Totals – Positives)
Positives occasionally update before totals do; do not revise negatives down, keep the last calculated negative.
Last Updated (Local Time) = (todays date + time = 00:00)
AK.name: Alaska

AL.notes:
Negatives = (Totals - Positives) 
Positives occasionally update before totals do; do not revise negatives down, keep the last calculated negative.
Last Updated (Local Time) = (current date + time = 00:00)
AL.name: Alabama

AR.notes:
Data is displayed across two web pages. timestamp provided by primary page, not dashboard. There are two different timestamps on the site: use the later one
[Dashboard](https://adem.maps.arcgis.com/apps/opsdashboard/index.html#/f533ac8a8b6040e5896b05b47b17a647)
AR.name: Arkansas

AS.notes:
American Samoa has limited official data available via press releases. 
[3/30 Update](http://www.samoagovt.ws/2020/03/ministry-of-health-coronavirus-covid-19-update-30-03-2020/)
AS.name: American Samoa

AZ.notes:
Dashboard now has a new tab that details total tested. 
Negative = Total - Positive
Hospital and ICU data [from Maricopa County](https://www.maricopa.gov/5460/Coronavirus-Disease-2019) and [Pima County](https://webcms.pima.gov/cms/One.aspx?portalId=169&pageId=527452)
AZ.name: Arizona

CA.notes: California has shown a huge number of pending tests. The state has been inconsistent in its timing of reporting, so we used faster updating sources until 4/1, when we standardized on [California's new data dashboards](https://public.tableau.com/views/COVID-19PublicDashboard/Covid-19Public?:embed=y&:display_count=no&:showVizHome=no). This led to a drop in cases and deaths, as the state's data lags some other sources. We assume that "tests conducted" = "people tested." Negatives and pending from California state 3/31 update. Hospitalization data from 4/1 Newsom press conference.
CA.name: California

CO.notes:
Negative = People Tested - Cases. Cases include people who test positive for COVID-19 AND people who have symptoms of COVID-19 and are a close contact to someone who tested positive. 
Data is updated daily by about 4 p.m. and includes cases reported through the previous day.
CO.name: Colorado

CT.notes:
Data is being provided in a PDF. 
Negative = Total - Positive.  
Positives occasionally update before totals do; we do not revise negatives down, keep the last calculated negative.
CT.name: Connecticut

DC.notes: Positive and Negative include both public and commercial labs.
DC.name: District Of Columbia

FL.notes:
We report using the raw data provided by FDOH.
On 3/26 their dashboard stopped including non-residents in its visible counts, but they still track them behind the scenes.  
On 3/21 negatives jumped due to change in methodology: they began including tests of people not investigated as PUIs.
FL.name: Florida

GA.notes:
Positive includes deaths. Positives occasionally update before totals do; we do not revise negatives down, keep the last calculated negative.
The page includes a "report generated" time at the bottom of the page and a data "as of" time. We use the "as of" time a the top of the page as our Update Time.
GA.name: Georgia

GU.notes:
Counts do not include 4 US sailors who tested positive are in quarantine on a naval base.
[3/31 AM Source - Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/GHSOCD/)
GU.name: Guam

HI.notes: Data now pulled from dashboard. Negatives no longer reported. The state [retracted](https://www.hawaiinewsnow.com/2020/03/24/state-officials-report-first-coronavirus-related-death-hawaii/) its first COVID-related death.
HI.name: Hawaii

IA.notes: If no timestamp was given, time = 00:00. Not all commercial labs report negatives to Iowa, as per their guidance.
IA.name: Iowa

ID.notes: Total includes Oregon residents tested in Idaho, as the state does in its table (noted below).  Negatives = Totals - Positives. Positives sometimes update before totals do; when this happens, we keep the last calculated negative.
ID.name: Idaho

IN.notes: Negative = Total – Positive. Totals are incomplete for private labs, so negatives are a lower bound.
IN.name: Indiana

KY.notes:
Negative = Total - Positive.
Negatives decreased for unknown reasons on 3/20.
KY.name: Kentucky

LA.notes: Total Tests = State Lab + Commercial Lab, Negative = Total Tests - Positive
LA.name: Louisiana

MA.notes: Positives include results from the CDC. Total tested includes repeat testing on individuals. State lab numbers are as of 8 am, other lab numbers are as of 11:30 am. Commercial lab numbers are subject to change.
MA.name: Massachusetts

ME.notes:
State does not report totals or negatives, last report was: 3/30
Use the time at the top row of the table.
ME.name: Maine

MI.notes: On 3/26, Michigan began reporting "total specimens" tested. We added this number 4/5 after much debate. It is an imperfect measure of "people tested," but is the only number the state offers. It is likely that fewer people have tested negative than this number indicates, but it is impossible to calculate a more realistic number.
MI.name: Michigan

MS.notes:
Negatives = Total tested - Positives
Hospitalizations are calculated by calculating multiplying % of hospitalized times total cases, pending clarification from the state.
MS.name: Mississippi

MT.notes: Negative = Total - Positive.  Each data field has its own timestamp, we use the most recent.
MT.name: Montana

NC.notes: Negative = Total tests* - total positives (where total tests include all data from public labs and partial data from hospital and commercial labs).
NC.name: North Carolina

ND.notes: As of 3/30, numbers reflect both public and private lab results.
ND.name: North Dakota

NE.notes:
Pending = Total - Positives - Negatives
If no timestamp was given, time = 00:00
NE.name: Nebraska

NH.notes: Negative count is from the four largest labs. Pending count is from the Public Health Laboratories only.
NH.name: New Hampshire

NJ.notes: Positive count includes deaths. Negatives now include all laboratories. Hospitalizations sometimes provided at press conferences. [Current number from 4/4](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-04-04/n-j-has-lost-more-people-from-covid-19-than-from-9-11-attacks).
NJ.name: New Jersey

NV.notes: Pending = Totals – Positives – Negatives. Individual data fields have different update times; we use the latest time as our "Last Update" time. NV is one of the rare states to distinguish # of people tested from # of samples tested.
NV.name: Nevada

NY.notes:
Numbers come from [press conference](https://www.governor.ny.gov). 
We are using discharged numbers as recovered
NY.name: New York

OH.notes: Ohio releases total tested regularly at press conferences.
OH.name: Ohio

OK.notes: Pending = "PUIs pending results." We exclude "Positive (Out-of-State)" results as we assume these individuals are isolated outside the state. Last Update time based on the "As of" time below the charts.
OK.name: Oklahoma

PA.notes: County level data doesn't add up to the totals provided. We are not adding deaths back into positives.
PA.name: Pennsylvania

PR.notes:
Puerto Rico reports positive, negative, and pending.
One positive was reclassified as a negative on 3/30
PR.name: Puerto Rico

SC.notes: Negatives only from state public health labs. Hospitalization data carried over from weekly 3/25 presentation.
SC.name: South Carolina

TN.notes: Tennessee now provides positive and negative test results from all laboratories. On 4/5, the state reported a decline in recoveries.
TN.name: Tennessee

TX.notes: We are assuming Texas is reporting only completed testing, pending further guidance, which we are seeking from the state.
TX.name: Texas

UT.notes: Positive count includes non-Utah residents. Negative = Total - Positive. Negative test results may lag for up to 72 hours, according to the state.
UT.name: Utah

VI.notes: Virgin Islands: Positive, Negative, and Pending provided.
VI.name: US Virgin Islands

WA.notes: As of 3/31, Washington is having [technical difficulties](https://www.doh.wa.gov/Portals/1/Documents/1600/coronavirus/DelayDataPosting.pdf) and reporting is sporadic. Last update was 4/03.
WA.name: Washington

WI.notes:
Updates expected at 2 pm CT. 
Negative test results are WI residents only and excludes duplicate lab results
WI.name: Wisconsin

WY.notes:
Wyoming's guidance is that commercial labs are only irregularly reporting negatives. 
Negatives = ((Total of all labs) - Positive) unless this results in a lower number of positives than previously reported
WY.name: Wyoming
